name: Idiopathic Systemic Capillary Leak Syndrome (ISCLS)
chief_complaint: I feel like I'm swelling up and can't breathe
treatment: aggressive IV fluid resuscitation with colloids
prognosis: High mortality (30-40%) in acute episodes; recurrent episodes common in survivors
description: A rare, life-threatening condition characterized by recurrent episodes of capillary hyperpermeability leading to massive fluid shifts from intravascular to extravascular space. The pathophysiology involves endothelial dysfunction with unknown triggers. Presents as sudden-onset shock with hemoconcentration and hypoalbuminemia without other explanation.
